cs351.utility

Class JobList

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs351.utility.JobList

  • public class JobList
extends java.lang.Object
    Note :: This class is not safe to be used by multiple threads at once. It is better to create segregated lists for each thread and let the job system deal with managing jobs concurrently. This class can be used to manage local copies of a job list before submitting them to the job system. The benefit to this is that you can build up a list of jobs to be executed but have strict control over when the job system gets to see them. Each list is capable of managing various layers of different-priority job lists. Keep in mind that once you tell the list to submit the jobs it is managing, it will submit all jobs to the job system for immediate execution and clear its local list. This includes all job lists for all priorities.

    • Constructor Detail

      • JobList

        public JobList(ParallelJobSystem jobSystem)

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(Job job,
                int priority)
        Adds a job of the given priority to the list. A job list will separate its jobs by priority, but when submit is called, all jobs of all priorities are submitted and the job system is notified of which job lists are of what priority.
        Parameters:
        job - job to submit
        priority - priority of the job (determines the list it goes in)

      • remove

        public void remove(Job job,
                   int priority)
        Removes a job from the list. This should only be called before submitting since once submit is called, all job lists are wiped.
        Parameters:
        job - job to remove
        priority - its priority (used to find it)

      • size

        public int size()
        Gets the size of all job lists that it is maintaining.
        Returns:
        size of all job lists combined

      • clear

        public void clear()

      • submitJobs

        public void submitJobs(boolean clearExistingData)
        Submits all jobs to the given job system. All lists are wiped afterwards so future calls to submitJobs will have no effect unless jobs are re-added.
        Parameters:
        clearExistingData - true if the job list should clear out the submitted jobs and false if it should keep them around for re-submission

      • containsActiveJobs

        public boolean containsActiveJobs()
        Checks to see if there are still jobs related to this job list that are pending completion with the multithreading system.
        Returns:
        true if jobs exist and false if all jobs have completed

      • waitForCompletion

        public void waitForCompletion()
        Returns only when the job system has completed all jobs that were associated with this list before being submitted.
